text: 1.6 has so many new cool things Every morning I go GitHub and discourse to check if Julia 1.6 is out - I have a few new packages depends on 1.6

elements.text: 1.6 has so many new cool things Every morning I go GitHub and discourse to check if Julia 1.6 is out - I have a few new packages depends on 1.6

text:
I am so tired of slow precompilation and wall of text conflict messages.
when ever i have to go back to 1.5

elements.text:
I am so tired of slow precompilation and wall of text conflict messages.
when ever i have to go back to 1.5

text:
Although sometimes I get cut, this is why I love living on the bleeding edge with Julia (building once or twice a day out of master :slightly_smiling_face: )
The rate of improvement is just fantastic.

elements.text: Although sometimes I get cut, this is why I love living on the bleeding edge with Julia (building once or twice a day out of master

)
The rate of improvement is just fantastic.

text: actually I just got an issue from someone using julia 1.4 yesterday evening lol

elements.text: actually I just got an issue from someone using julia 1.4 yesterday evening lol

text: I’ve been working on two new packages that are only possible in 1.6, can’t wait releasing the first version of them!

elements.text: I’ve been working on two new packages that are only possible in 1.6, can’t wait releasing the first version of them!

text: Also, sometimes I feel I can lend value as a canary, detecting issues quickly in master.

elements.text: Also, sometimes I feel I can lend value as a canary, detecting issues quickly in master.

text: What are the two packages, and what 1.6 features do they depend on?

elements.text: What are the two packages, and what 1.6 features do they depend on?

text: mainly YaoCompiler, depends on the new abstract interpretation mechanism, and we just implemented const prop on `IRCode` in it too! so it finally works in most of the cases.

elements.text: mainly YaoCompiler, depends on the new abstract interpretation mechanism, and we just implemented const prop on
in it too! so it finally works in most of the cases.

text: the other is the BQCESubroutine depends on a new `reinterpret` reshape interface for optimization

elements.text: the other is the BQCESubroutine depends on a new

text: I need to give a talk tomorrow on qhack 2021, so I’ve been checking if Julia 1.6 is released or not. I wanted to show off this during my talk… but I guess I’ll just not do it this Fri:joy:
